reviewText: A schooner roams the sea with a huge, hidden gun looking for German submarines to sink. The captain falls in love with a beautiful blonde who turns out to be a German spy. This film is directed by John Ford, which is a plus, but the acting is subpar. There is some action at sea and also some intrigue in port, but this is an average film which you can skip without missing much.
The special effects for a 1930's film were astounding. Georg O'Brien is a breath of fresh air as a leading man.
